Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2013 11:54PM antbigler wrote: Im scheduled for nipple sparing UMX left side on Sept 18 with an immediate implant.  All I'm thinking about is everything that can go wrong.  My mind will not stop, and I'm scared of what I will be waking up to after surgery.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 12:09AM - edited Aug 26, 2013 09:06PM by antbigler I understand - it is hard to continue on with everday life waiting for the surgery and everything that comes with it.  I was diagnosed in April, but delayed my surgery hoping that my tumor would shrink, making a lumpectomy more appealing.  My tumor has not really shrunk, it is still 3cm x 3cm x 4cm.  Oncologist felt very positive about being able to shrink tumor and I was onboard.  Now I'm scheduled for UMX in September.  Thankfully, I just work part time and my son is 17.  Still it is difficult to stay engaged and care about other things.  I have days where I come in from work and can not make my self do anything else.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 02:08PM antbigler wrote: (Tdickinson) - Thanks for your story.  I too have very dense breast tissue.  My oncotype was an 11 - very low chance of reocurrence.  I am on Tamoxifen due to High PR/ER +.  I have had 2 MRI's since April - Right breast is fine and my BRCA1/2 were negative.  Still even with all the information and research, I'm afraid I'm making the wrong choice.  Someone posted earlier PTSD and after 4 1/2 months I have those feelings.  You can plan and research but ultimately, the end result is what it is.  I sound like the voice of doom - I'm sorry.  My mind is in a dark place and when I think too much about what is coming, the anxiety takes over. Rationally, I know I will get through this - but I'm 48 and I feel like it has taken so much away from me.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie
